attributes.action: Change the amount carers receive when giving 35 hours care a week to receive £64
attributes.additional_details: I am going to start a petition I am going to fight this I’m going to get it to the parliament and I need as much help and support I can get I will dedicate my time in getting the 10.000 signatures needed and I will fight for the rights of disabled people and there devoted carers !!!!
attributes.background: Full time carers have continuously given a minimum of 35 hours per week leaving no time for a paid job - no help with there own needs such as help towards there own health and medicine and transportation for a tiny amount of £64 per week legal minimum wage is going to £8.21 ph why cares get less ???

rejection.details:
We understand you are concerned about the allowance given to carers whose duties involve at least 35 hours a week, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. 

Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. For example, you could start a petition to increase the amount paid as carer's allowance to match the minimum wage, if that is what you'd like to see happen.
